    161 stripComments = function(fileStr) {

    1814 uid = '_' + +new Date();
    1914 primitives = [];
    2014 primIndex = 0;
    2114 return fileStr.replace(/(['"])(\\\1|.)+?\1/g, function(match) {
    2234 primitives[primIndex] = match;
    2334 return (uid + '') + primIndex++;
    24 }).replace(/([^\/])(\/(?!\*|\/)(\\\/|.)+?\/[gim]{0,3})/g, function(match, $1, $2) {

    381 getFilePath = function() {
    399 var filePath, filePathPattern;
    409 filePathPattern = "" + (process.cwd()) + "/config%s.json";
    419 filePath = null;
    429 switch (process.env.NODE_ENV) {
    43 case 'test':
    442 filePath = util.format(filePathPattern, '-test');
    452 if (!fs.existsSync(filePath)) {
    461 filePath = util.format(filePathPattern, '');
    47 }
    482 break;
    49 case 'staging':
    502 filePath = util.format(filePathPattern, '-staging');
    512 if (!fs.existsSync(filePath)) {
    521 filePath = util.format(filePathPattern, '');
    53 }
    542 break;
    55 case 'production':
    561 filePath = util.format(filePathPattern, '');
    571 break;
    58 default:
    594 filePath = util.format(filePathPattern, '-dev');
    604 if (!fs.existsSync(filePath)) {
    612 filePath = util.format(filePathPattern, '');
    62 }
    63 }
    649 return filePath;
    65 };

    67 /**
    68 * Load a JSON file and strip comments.

    70 * @param {object} defaultConfig the default configuration to use
    71 * @return {object} the JSON object loaded configuration

    751 loadConfigFile = function(filePath, defaultConfig) {
    7615 var config, defaultConfigKey, defaultConfigValue, error, fileConfig, fileConfigKey, fileConfigValue, fileContent, logMsg, logObj;
    7715 config = {};
    7815 for (defaultConfigKey in defaultConfig) {
    793 defaultConfigValue = defaultConfig[defaultConfigKey];
    803 config[defaultConfigKey] = defaultConfigValue;
    81 }
    8215 fileContent = null;
    8315 if ((filePath == null) && (defaultConfig == null)) {
    849 filePath = getFilePath();
    85 }
    8615 try {
    8715 fileContent = fs.readFileSync(filePath);
    88 } catch (_error) {
    891 error = _error;
    901 fileContent = null;
    911 logMsg = 'Could not read config file, returning empty config object.';
    921 logObj = {
    93 file_path: filePath,
    94 err: error
    95 };
    961 if ((error.code != null) && error.code === 'ENOENT') {
    971 logger.warn(logObj, logMsg);
    98 } else {
    990 logger.error(logObj, logMsg);
    100 }
    101 }
    10215 if (fileContent != null) {
    10314 fileContent = stripComments(fileContent.toString());
    10414 fileConfig = JSON.parse(fileContent);
    10513 for (fileConfigKey in fileConfig) {
    10614 fileConfigValue = fileConfig[fileConfigKey];
    10714 config[fileConfigKey] = process.env[fileConfigKey] || fileConfigValue;
    108 }
    10913 logger.info("Using config file located at: %s", filePath);
    110 }
    11114 return config;
    112 };

    114 /**

    1231 saveConfigToFile = function(config, filePath, done) {

    1251 filePath = filePath || getFilePath();

    8 /**
    9 * Utility function creating a domain with a bound id
    10 * provided or generated.
    11 * @param {Object} req the http request object
    12 * @param {Object} res the http response object
    13 * @param {String} id an optional request identifier
    14 * @return {Domain} a Domain instance
    15 */
    16
    17
    181 createRequestDomain = function(req, res, id) {
    190 var domain;
    200 domain = Domain.create();
    210 domain.id = id != null ? id : uuidGen.v4();
    220 domain.add(req);
    230 domain.add(res);
    240 return domain;
    25 };
    26
    27 /**
    28 * Middleware that binds middleware chain of executions to a domain
    29 * (Useful binding a request ID to an execution context eg: the default logger
    30 * always tries to log domain.id by default)
    31 */
    32
    33
    341 domainMiddleware = function(req, res, next) {
    350 var domain;
    360 domain = createRequestDomain(req, res);
    370 domain.run(function() {
    380 return next();
    39 });
    400 return domain.on('error', function(err) {
    410 return next(err);
    42 });
    43 };
    44
    451 module.exports = {
    46 domainMiddleware: domainMiddleware,
    47 createRequestDomain: createRequestDomain

    8 /**
    9 * Transforms a dictionary of key/value pairs into its string representation compatible with the HTTP headers format.
    10 * @param {object} dict A dictionary of key/value pairs representing HTTP headers' name/value.
    11 * @return {string} A string representing the same dictionary but as a plain HTTP header.
    12 */
    13
    14
    151 buildRawHttpHeadersFromDict = function(dict) {
    162 var headerField, headerName, headerValue, rawHeaders;
    172 rawHeaders = '';
    182 for (headerName in dict) {
    1910 headerValue = dict[headerName];
    2010 headerField = headerName + ': ' + headerValue + '\r\n';
    2110 rawHeaders += headerField;
    22 }
    232 return rawHeaders;
    24 };
    25
    26 /**
    27 * Trandforms a request object into raw HTTP headers.
    28 * @param {http.IncomingMessage} req a request object passed by node to a callback.
    29 * @return {string} A string representing the request's header but as a plain HTTP header.
    30 */
    31
    32
    331 buildRawHttpHeadersFromRequest = function(req) {
    340 var path, rawHeaders, uri;
    350 if (req.url != null) {
    360 uri = url.parse(req.url);
    370 path = uri.pathname;
    38 } else {
    390 path = req.path;
    40 }
    410 rawHeaders = req.method + ' ' + path + ' ' + 'HTTP/' + req.httpVersion;
    420 rawHeaders = rawHeaders + '\r\n' + buildRawHttpHeadersFromDict(req.headers);
    430 return rawHeaders;
    44 };
    45
    46 /**
    47 * Parses HTTP raw headers and returns a dictionary object with
    48 * key/value pairs representing each header name/value.
    49 * @param {string} rawHeadersString the raw HTTP headers as a string.
    50 * @return {object} a dictionary object with key/value pairs representing each header name/value.
    51 */
    52
    53
    541 buildHeadersDictFromRawHeaders = function(rawHeadersString) {
    550 var headerName, headerTuple, headerTupleString, headerValue, headers, headersDict, _i, _len;
    560 if (rawHeadersString != null) {
    570 headers = rawHeadersString.split('\r\n');
    580 headers.splice(0, 1);
    590 headersDict = {};
    600 for (_i = 0, _len = headers.length; _i < _len; _i++) {
    610 headerTupleString = headers[_i];
    620 headerTupleString = headerTupleString.substring(0);
    630 headerTuple = headerTupleString.split(':');
    640 headerName = headerTuple[0];
    650 if (headerName === "host") {
    660 headerValue = headerTuple[1];
    670 if (headerTuple[2] != null) {
    680 headerValue += ':' + headerTuple[2];
    69 }
    70 } else {
    710 headerValue = headerTuple[1];
    72 }
    730 if (headerValue) {
    740 headerValue = headerValue.substring(1);
    750 headersDict[headerName] = headerValue;
    76 }
    77 }
    780 return headersDict;
    79 }
    80 };
    81
    82 /**
    83 * Parses raw HTTP headers and returns the HTTP status code.
    84 * @param {string} rawHeadersString raw HTTP headers.
    85 * @return {integer} An integer representing the HTTP status code included in the headers.
    86 */
    87
    88
    891 getStatusCodeFromRawHeaders = function(rawHeadersString) {
    900 var headers, httpStatusCodeRegexp, match;
    910 if (rawHeadersString != null) {
    920 headers = rawHeadersString.split('\r\n');
    930 headers.splice(1);
    940 httpStatusCodeRegexp = new RegExp('HTTP/\\d\\.\\d (\\d\\d\\d).*');
    950 match = httpStatusCodeRegexp.exec(headers);
    960 if (match && match.length >= 2) {
    970 return parseInt(match[1]);
    98 }
    99 }
    100 };
    101
    102 /**
    103 * Adds a prefix to the path of href HTML tags contained in a string when the path is absolute.
    104 * @param {string} htmlContent a string representing some content that can contain href HTML tags.
    105 * @param {string} hrefPrefix the prefix to add to hrefs' paths that are absolute.
    106 * @return {string} the same content as htmlContent, but with hrefs prefixed.
    107 */
    108
    109
    1101 prefixAbsoluteHrefsWith = function(htmlContent, hrefPrefix) {
    11110 if (htmlContent != null) {
    11210 htmlContent = htmlContent.replace(/(href=[\"\'])(https?:\/\/[^\/]*?)?(:?)(\d+)?\/(.*?)([\"\'])/g, "$1$2$3$4" + hrefPrefix + "/$5$6");
    113 }
    11410 return htmlContent;
    115 };
    116
    117 /**
    118 * Replaces host and port by a different host and port in hrefs contained within some content.
    119 * @param {string} htmlContent some content containing href HTML tags.
    120 * @param {object} from a dictionary with two keys host and port that specify what host and port to change in href tags.
    121 * @param {[type]} to a dictionary with two keys host and port that specify the new host and port value for the
    122 * matching href tags.
    123 * @return {string} the new content with replacements made.
    124 */
    125
    126
    1271 replaceHostAndPortInHrefs = function(htmlContent, from, to) {
    12812 var hrefReplacerRegexp, protocol, replacementString, replacerRegexpString, sourceProtocol;
    12912 if ((from == null) || (to == null) || (htmlContent == null)) {
    1300 return htmlContent;
    131 }
    13212 sourceProtocol = "https?:\/\/";
    13312 if (from.protocol != null) {
    1344 sourceProtocol = "" + from.protocol + ":\/\/";
    135 }
    13612 logger.debug('from: %s, to: %s', util.inspect(from, util.inspect(to)));
    13712 replacerRegexpString = ("(href=[\"\'])(" + sourceProtocol + ")?") + from.host;
    13812 if (from.port != null) {
    13910 replacerRegexpString = replacerRegexpString + ':?' + from.port + '?';
    140 }
    14112 replacerRegexpString += '(\/)(.*)?([\"\'])';
    14212 protocol = "$2";
    14312 if (to.protocol != null) {
    1448 protocol = "" + to.protocol + "://";
    145 }
    14612 replacementString = "$1" + protocol + to.host;
    14712 if (to.port != null) {
    14810 replacementString += ':' + to.port;
    149 }
    15012 replacementString += "$3$4$5";
    15112 hrefReplacerRegexp = new RegExp(replacerRegexpString, 'g');
    15212 htmlContent = htmlContent.replace(hrefReplacerRegexp, replacementString);
    15312 return htmlContent;
    154 };
    155
    156 /**
    157 * Performs some transformation on raw headers as a string and returns the transformed headers.
    158 * @param {string} headers complete raw HTTP headers.
    159 * @param {object} transforms a dictionary specifying which transformations to apply to the headers.
    160 * The keys are the header fields' name to transform and their new value.
    161 * A special key named "pathReplace" exists that allows you to specify a new path for the request.
    162 * @return {string} transformed raw HTTP headers.
    163 */
    164
    165
    1661 proxyHeaders = function(headers, transforms) {
    1670 var fromRegexp, headerName, headerValue, headersDict, headersList, request, requests, transformedHeaders, _ref;
    1680 if (headers != null) {
    1690 headersList = headers.split('\r\n');
    1700 requests = headersList.splice(0, 1);
    1710 request = null;
    1720 if ((requests != null) && requests.length >= 1) {
    1730 request = requests[0];
    174 }
    1750 if (request != null) {
    1760 if ((transforms != null) && (transforms.pathReplace != null)) {
    1770 logger.debug('Replacing request line in headers...');
    1780 logger.debug('Original: [%s]', request);
    1790 fromRegexp = new RegExp(escape(transforms.pathReplace.from), 'g');
    1800 request = request.replace(fromRegexp, transforms.pathReplace.to);
    1810 logger.debug('New: [%s]', request);
    182 }
    1830 headersDict = buildHeadersDictFromRawHeaders(headers);
    1840 transformedHeaders = headers;
    1850 logger.debug('headersDict: %s, transforms: %s', util.inspect(headersDict, util.inspect(transforms)));
    1860 if ((headersDict != null) && (transforms != null)) {
    1870 _ref = transforms.headers;
    1880 for (headerName in _ref) {
    1890 headerValue = _ref[headerName];
    1900 logger.debug('Replace header with name [%s] with value [%s]', headerName, headerValue);
    1910 headersDict[headerName] = headerValue;
    192 }
    1930 transformedHeaders = buildRawHttpHeadersFromDict(headersDict);
    194 }
    1950 return request + '\r\n' + transformedHeaders + '\r\n';
    196 }
    197 }
    198 };
    199
    2001 module.exports = {

    961 _loadStreams = function(streamsPath) {
    970 var nodeEnv, streams;
    980 if (streamsPath != null) {
    990 nodeEnv = process.env.NODE_ENV || 'development';
    1000 streams = _.values(requireDir(streamsPath));
    1010 return streams = _.filter(streams, function(stream) {
    1020 var eligible;
    1030 eligible = _.contains(stream.env, nodeEnv);
    1040 if (eligible && _.isFunction(stream.init)) {
    1050 stream.init();
    106 }
    1070 return eligible;
    108 });
    109 }
    110 };
    111
    112 /**
    113 * Monitors the log levels file and changes corresponding
    114 * streams' log level accordingly
    115 * @param {String} optionFilePath the path to the config file
    116 */
    117
    118
    1191 _monitorLogLevels = function(optionFilePath) {
    1200 var refreshLevels, refreshing;
    1210 refreshing = false;
    1220 refreshLevels = function() {
    1230 refreshing = true;
    1240 defaultLogger.debug("Reloading log levels", optionFilePath);
    1250 return setTimeout(function() {
    1260 var err, stream, streamOptions, _i, _len, _ref;
    1270 delete require.cache[require.resolve(optionFilePath)];
    1280 streamOptions = require(optionFilePath);
    1290 try {
    1300 _ref = defaultLogger.streams;
    1310 for (_i = 0, _len = _ref.length; _i < _len; _i++) {
    1320 stream = _ref[_i];
    1330 defaultLogger.levels(stream.name, streamOptions[stream.name]);
    134 }
    135 } catch (_error) {
    1360 err = _error;
    1370 defaultLogger.error(err);
    138 }
    1390 return refreshing = false;
    140 }, 100);
    141 };
    1420 if (optionFilePath != null) {
    1430 refreshLevels();
    1440 return fs.watchFile(optionFilePath, function(curr, prev) {
    1450 if (!refreshing) {
    1460 return refreshLevels();
    147 }
    148 });
    149 }
    150 };
    151
    152 /**
    153 * Injects the active execution context ID in the log message
    154 * if it exists
    155 */
    156
    157
    1581 _patchReqIdInjection = function() {
    1590 var origEmit;
    1600 origEmit = bunyan.prototype._emit;
    1610 return bunyan.prototype._emit = function(rec, noemit) {
    1620 if (process.domain != null) {
    1630 rec.req_id = process.domain.id;
    164 }
    1650 return origEmit.call(this, rec, noemit);
    166 };
    167 };

    169 /**
    170 * Middleware logging express routes' accesses
    171 * @param {String} level the min level at which logs will be emitted
    172 */
    173
    174
    1751 routeAccessLogMiddleware = function(level) {
    1760 var expressBunyan;
    1770 if (level == null) {
    1780 level = 'trace';
    179 }
    1800 expressBunyan = require('express-bunyan-logger')({
    181 genReqId: false,
    182 logger: defaultLogger
    183 });
    1840 return function(req, res, next) {
    1850 if ((bunyan.levelFromName[level] >= defaultLogger.level()) && req.method !== 'OPTIONS') {
    1860 return expressBunyan(req, res, next);
    187 } else {
    1880 return next();
    189 }
    190 };
    191 };
    192
    193 /**
    194 * Returns the default logger with its serializers and

    196 * @return {Object} a bunyan logger
    197 */
    198
    199
    2001 getDefaultLogger = function(streamsPath) {

    2020 defaultLogger = bunyan.createLogger({

    204 level: 'debug',
    205 serializers: {
    206 req: _reqSerializer,
    207 res: bunyan.stdSerializers.res,
    208 err: bunyan.stdSerializers.err,
    209 controller: _controllerSerializer,
    210 module: _moduleSerializer
    211 },
    212 streams: _loadStreams(streamsPath)
    213 });
    214 }
    2150 return defaultLogger;
    216 };

    2280 _monitorLogLevels(logLevelsConfPath);

    81 getNetworkAddress = function() {

    120 iface = interfaces[devName];
    130 i = 0;
    140 while (i < iface.length) {

    20 }

    11(function() {
    21 var crypto, encrypt, formatLogErrorMessage, prefix, replaceCharInKeys;
    3
    41 crypto = require('crypto');
    5
    6 /**
    7 * Replaces given character in object's keys recursively
    8 * @param {Object} obj the object for which keys need to be reformatted
    9 * @param {String} char the string that needs to be replaced
    10 * @param {String} newChar the replacement string
    11 */
    12
    13
    141 replaceCharInKeys = function(obj, char, newChar) {
    157 var key;
    167 if (typeof obj === "object") {
    173 for (key in obj) {
    186 if (obj.hasOwnProperty(key)) {
    196 obj[key.replace(char, newChar)] = replaceCharInKeys(obj[key], char, newChar);
    206 if (key.indexOf(char) > -1) {
    214 delete obj[key];
    22 }
    23 }
    24 }
    25 }
    267 return obj;
    27 };
    28
    291 prefix = function(stringToPrefix, prefix) {
    303 if (stringToPrefix.indexOf(prefix) !== 0) {
    312 return prefix + stringToPrefix;
    32 }
    331 return stringToPrefix;
    34 };
    35
    36 /**
    37 * Encryption function that should be used mostly to generate token hashes.
    38 * This utility function shouldn't be used to encrypt passwords or
    39 * sensitive data. User account passwords are encrypted using a slower but
    40 * more secure way using bcrypt.
    41 * @param {Strin} string the string to be hsahsed
    42 * @param {String} cryptoKey the crypto key salt string
    43 * @return {String} the hashed value of the input string in a hex format
    44 */
    45
    46
    471 encrypt = function(string, cryptoKey) {
    480 return crypto.createHmac('sha512', cryptoKey).update(string).digest('hex');
    49 };
    50
    51 /**
    52 * Provides a uniform way of formatting error messages with
    53 * information on the user logged in and the route invoked
    54 * @param {Object} req the http request object
    55 * @param {Object} err the error instance
    56 * @return {String}
    57 */
    58
    59
    601 formatLogErrorMessage = function(req, err) {
    610 var _ref;
    620 return "User ID: " + ((_ref = req.user) != null ? _ref._id : void 0) + " - Uri: " + req.originalUrl + " : " + (err.toString());
    63 };
    64
    651 module.exports = {
    66 prefix: prefix,
    67 encrypt: encrypt,
    68 replaceCharInKeys: replaceCharInKeys,
    69 formatLogErrorMessage: formatLogErrorMessage
    70 };
